Rokugatsu no Yume

n
Prologue: A Moment of Peace
By Shimazu Masayoshi
	
	Shimabara District, K=
yoto
	1st Year of Genji, 6th month, 1st day (July 1, 1864)

11 PM

Hijikata=
 Toshizou was late. For once, outside of his daily routine of
being a "demo=
n", he was actually concerned with the opinion of someone
aside from himsel=
f. Finally coming to his objective, he paused for
breath, taking little tim=
e to read the writing on the paper lantern
outside, which he'd memorized lo=
ng ago: Sakurada-ya

	"Irasshaimase! Welcome, Hijikata-dono! Asako is waiti=
ng for you
upstairs."

	Hijikata slipped out of his sandals and went up the=
 stairs, without
even glancing at the young maid, who stared after him with=
 a combined
sense of fear and wistful romantic longing. She'd wanted him to=
 linger
around a bit longer, but the vice-commander of the Shinsengumi was
=
already up the stairs and with his hand on the door. Sliding it open,
he bo=
wed curtly.
	
	"Omadaseshimashita. Sorry to keep you waiting, Asako-chan."
=

	"Hijikata-sama=85I was so worried!"
	
	"It's alright=85" Shutting the doo=
r, he sat down in front of the
courtesan, who carefully poured sake for the=
 two of them into small
saucers.

	"You've been working hard, I'm sure, Hij=
ikata-sama. Please feel free
to relax tonight."

	Gratefully accepting the =
sake, he sipped it slowly. "Things have been
getting quiet recently. Too qu=
iet=85"

	"Maybe you should enjoy the quiet while you can? Peace, like the
=
beautiful cherry blossoms, does not linger for long."

	He set his drink do=
wn, and edged closer.

	"Yeah? And will you help me with that?"

	A passion=
ate smile passed over her face as she felt her legs go numb
from the erotic=
 thrill that swept through her body.

	"And how would a simple courtesan li=
ke me help you, the great and
marvelous vice-commander of the Shinsengumi?"=


	For a moment, there was humanity in the demon's eyes. He brought
Asako's=
 hand to his face, and touched her face with his own. Asako
wasn't sure, bu=
t she thought that she saw tears form in his eyes for
the briefest of insta=
nts.

	"By helping me enjoy a moment of peace=85"

	She undid the simple kn=
ot at the front of her kimono, letting the
silk fabric fall away, leaving t=
he pale richness of her bare skin and
full curves of her body exposed to th=
e dim candlelight. The demon
wasted no time in taking her into his arms. An=
d for a moment, there
was peace in that small room in Shimabara=85

	July 2nd

	2 AM

	As Hijikata and Asako still pursued their moment o=
f peace, Saitou
Hajime, captain of the Shinsengumi 3rd squad, awoke in a ge=
isha house
in Gion, after a long night of lovemaking. Feeling the touch of =
his
lover's deft, slender hands, he momentarily gasped before regaining
sel=
f-control.

	"Mmm=85Hajime-sama=85your fundoshi was sooo starched=85"

	"Go=
od thing it's out of the way now, eh, Chise-chan?"

	"Oh yes=85"

	Saitou c=
losed his eyes and breathed deeply of Chise's perfume. She
took such incred=
ible care to be the best for him, and he wanted to
show her every bit of hi=
s gratitude.

	"I meant to ask, Chise-chan, how's your novel about the 47 l=
oyal
retainers coming?"

	"Very well=85I just had my heroine inadvertently =
bump into Horibe
Yasubee-sama's hidden stash of illicit woodblock prints=85=
"

	He laughed. True to their reputation, geisha were quite engaging and
en=
tertaining in everything=85

	"Sounds like a rather embarrassing moment for=
 Horibe-dono."

	"Indeed=85he was most definitely not pleased. Although, ev=
en though he
didn't say it, he was rather amused by the whole incident."

	=
"I see=85well, shall we, in turn, amuse ourselves again?"

	"So impatient, =
Hajime-sama=85" she said playfully. "Yes, let's get back
to amusing ourselv=
es=85" And then, like Hijikata, Saitou Hajime also
